Screens Details: Global Role‑Based Access Control (RBAC): after vendor login, the app decodes JWT modules (canRead/canWrite) and enables access based on assigned rights. The sidebar shows only the modules the vendor/user is allowed to view.
Issues details: Backend must provide consistent module keys inside the JWT; if module naming changes, normalization/mapping needs an update.
Query: How do vendor rights control which modules open?
Answers: Both sidebar filtering and route protection enforce permissions: canRead is required to view; canWrite is required for create/edit/delete. If a user tries to open a restricted module, they see an “Access Denied” page.

Screens Details: Route Guard / ProtectedRoute: all major routes are protected via a route→module mapping (Vehicle, Employee, School, Route, Tracking, Scheduling, Accounting, Access, etc.), with a dedicated Unauthorized page for better UX.
Issues details: Token expiry validation is currently commented; can be improved with refresh/expiry handling for production hardening.
Query: What level of security/module guarding is implemented?
Answers: Per‑route permission checks are implemented; safe routes are allowed, protected routes require explicit module read/write permissions; unauthorized UX is implemented.

Screens Details: Access Management (Users & Permissions): user listing (UserCard), Create Access form (CreateAccessCard), edit and delete flows with confirmation modal, and toast/loader feedback.
Issues details: Roles/terminals/modules APIs must stay stable; if backend response shape changes, mapping updates may be required.
Query: What is completed in Access Management?
Answers: Vendor/admin can create and edit users, assign roles, terminals, departments/modules, set Read Only vs Read & Write control, and remove users (soft delete).

Screens Details: Module visibility control in sidebar: SchoolDashboardSidebar filters menu items by required module keys (Vehicle/Employee/School/Route/Tracking/Chat/Invoices/Access, etc.) and only shows items where user has canRead=true.
Issues details: Depends on JWT modules; plural/singular key differences are already handled (basic normalization).
Query: How does the app decide which sidebar items are visible?
Answers: If the user has read permission for a module, the menu item is visible; otherwise it is hidden to keep the UI clean and secure.

Screens Details: Vehicle module UI & flows: vehicle listing, add vehicle screen, details display, and UI refresh; vehicles are also usable in Route Management dropdowns.
Issues details: Full CRUD, validations, search/pagination, and status lifecycle (active/maintenance) need completion via backend integration.
Query: What is the current status of Vehicle Management?
Answers: Core UI flows are implemented and stable; remaining work is completing API integration, validations, and operational features (maintenance/defects/documents) as per scope.

Screens Details: Employee module UI & flows: employee listing, add/edit forms, detail views; driver selection is reused inside Route Management.
Issues details: Document uploads (licenses/certificates), role‑specific rules, full CRUD edge cases, and pagination/search need completion.
Query: What is the current status of Employee Management?
Answers: UI CRUD experience is built and data can be displayed; remaining work is backend hardening, document uploads, validations, and permissions fine‑tuning.

Screens Details: School module UI & workflow: vendor can add a school, see it in the school listing, and use school selection to drive downstream flows (e.g., student loading/assignment).
Issues details: Full school CRUD, validations, vendor‑specific permissions, and complete student management under school (bulk import optional) are pending.
Query: What is the vendor workflow in School Management?
Answers: Schools can be added and viewed in the portal; selecting a school supports student workflows. Remaining work is completing backend CRUD and student management features.

Screens Details: Route module major progress: route listing + details + create route flow (name/number/date/time, driver, vehicle, school, students). Pickup/dropoff Places Autocomplete is integrated; create‑route API payload mapping was aligned to backend DTO keys.
Issues details: Route stops/coordinates availability is a backend dependency; edit/delete, stop management, and scheduling linkage are pending.
Query: What is strongly completed in Route Management?
Answers: Create Route, correct API mapping, and route map viewing are implemented. Polyline uses Directions when stops exist; if a new route has no stops/coords yet, the UI shows a clear “No stops/coordinates” state (no misleading fake polyline).

Screens Details: Tracking module UI: tracking screen and map layout are present for route/vehicle tracking.
Issues details: Live location feed (API/WebSocket), marker updates, polling strategy, and performance tuning are pending.
Query: What is the current status of Real‑time Tracking?
Answers: UI is ready; remaining work is integrating live tracking data and implementing reliable real‑time updates.

Screens Details: Route scheduling UI: schedule screens are available and linked from the sidebar.
Issues details: Scheduling business logic, schedule CRUD APIs, conflict validations, and recurring schedules are pending.
Query: What is the current status of Route Scheduling?
Answers: UI structure is ready; remaining work is backend integration and scheduling rules/validations.

Screens Details: Chat monitoring UI: vendor chat screens/layout are available.
Issues details: Real-time chat integration, message history APIs, attachments, and moderation tools are pending.
Query: What is the current status of Chat Monitoring?
Answers: UI is ready; remaining work is backend/WebSocket integration, attachments, and unread counters.

Screens Details: Accounting UI: dashboards/tables and navigation are available.
Issues details: Reports/exports/reconciliation and backend integration are pending.
Query: What is the current status of Accounting?
Answers: UI is ready; remaining work is accounting data APIs, exports, and calculations validation.

Screens Details: Feedback/support UI exists and supports the intended workflow.
Issues details: Backend submission/listing and optional notification triggers are pending.
Query: What is the current status of Feedback?
Answers: UI is ready; remaining work is backend integration and status tracking if required.

Issues details: AWS S3 upload/download integration, permissions, and metadata/versioning handling are pending.
Query: What is the current status of Documents?
Answers: UI is ready; remaining work is storage integration (S3) and access control.
